result.execSummary:
The defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from Court to DE's letter dated 1/4/16

Defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendation.  Plea to Count 1 amended to 941.23(2).  Dismiss/read in Count 2.  Plea to Count 3.   Attorney Middleton agrees.  Court goes through plea agreement with defendant.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty. Attorney Middleton makes sentencing argument.  Request a stay of the sentence.  State responds.  Attorney Middleton clarifies.  Defendant makes final statement to court.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$243.00 fine or costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
20 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Jail to commence  EMP, ATIP and JAIP approved, per court rules.  Transfer to Dane County Jail, per jail rules.  Jail to commence on or before December 28, 2015 at 6 p.m.  
*ALL BOND TO BE APPLIED TO FINES/COSTS.  ($1,000.00 BOND TO APPLY)
Count 3:
$243.00 fine or costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
40 days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive to any other sentences.  
Submit to DNA sample.
Paperwork handed in court.

Credit Stipulation to be filed by Dec. 21, 2015.

Attorney Gumz for Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gumz is unable to advise of defendant's whereabouts.  Begin bond forfeiture.  Court advises hearing will be set.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago
Current: 8949 W. Clayton Road, Fitchburg, WI 53711 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2015)
Prior: 921 Dane Street, Madison, WI 53713

Defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Near resolution about 30 days out.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton gives status.  Request reset.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago by video from LEC with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton explains reason for nonappearance by DE and requests prior bond be reinstated.  State requests $1,500 cash bond be required.  Atty Middleton responds/requests prior bond be reinstated.  Court orders an additional $500.00 cash bond for a total of $1,000.00 on this matter.  All other previous bond conditions to continue.  Return date scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton gives status.  Unsure of whereabouts.  Warrant stay is lifted.  Begin bond forfeiture.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton states he spoke to DE on 9/1/2015 and it was reset to 9/4/2015 and now it was reset to today.  Requests one more reset to Friday.  State objects.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stays it until 9/14/2015.  Return date scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant was stayed. Atty. Middleton requests until 9/8/15  Return date scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton request stay be continued.  Today was first day of school for defendant.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton gives status; was expecting her to appear.  State request warrant stayed.  Court allows stay of warrant.  Return date scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Absolute Sobriety; Not operate m/v w/o valid DL

Pre-trial conference at 08-14-2015 10:00 am.
Return date at 08-25-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago by video from LEC with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Raschel L. Hotchkiss DeSantiago in custody.  Sue Mueller and intern Rick S appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  State requests cash bond w/conditions.  Atty Middleton responds/requests signature bond.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to operate MV w/o valid DL, absolute sobriety at all times and not to possess any controlled substances or paraphernalia w/o valid prescription.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
